intro: Paederia tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread paederia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and compound leaves with opposite arrangement. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
